IGcTAKCBb7aYhgzyngJCVw.text: Very good.. the meals were definitely worth the money... a coworker and i went here after work for dinner and were not disappointed! The service was great and food came out in a timely manner... over all experience was quite pleasant

p5qWeRxf29fQBwmv7dkjPA.text: Great food, great music, no complaints about service.  We were given a very large table which made out party of 7 and a baby very comfortable.

rySRAL4tYuJJ8k45_jfITw.text: I ate there with my Mother on a Wednesday evening. Wasn't too busy, drinks were awesome, our food was prompt and very good. Our waitress was personable and the manager came around to each table to ensure everything was acceptable. I'll be recommending to the boss for happy hour and lunches. I'll definitely be back!!

LBXeAWPyE1ufu63I0kMcQg.text: We were on our way to PF Chang when we noticed walnut grill, I never heard of it apparently there are four or five others so we tried it, we were very satisfied with our food and that consisted of the stuffed banana peppers a cheeseburger fish tacos grilled veggies and loaded tater tot's. Food was very good service was very good atmosphere was a good first time I was ever there and I have no complaints definitely recommend it!!

ixKnM5tcRLRhpFUNlIeEYw.text: This Walnut Grill location was absolutely terrible. The service and our appetizer started out great, however after that everything went down hill. Our waiter, although nice, came to our table about every 2 minutes and 30 seconds . He kindly explained to us that the kitchen had messed up and was remaking half of our parties meal and would be out very shortly. When I specifically got my food (buffalo chicken Flatbread which is what I normally get) all of the toppings, including the cheese, fell right off of the Flatbread. I should have taken pictures because as I came to find out, while the bread was cooked the cheese was not and there was about 7 pounds of Buffalo sauce on the meal. I do understand he had brought my food out literally seconds after it was done but if he would have explained to me that it was just pulled out and it would be a little longer, I would have been fine with that.   To that note we waited a good 30 minutes for our actual meals to come out after the appetizer, which to me is unacceptable. It was also not even close to busy.   Overall, this location was a pretty big flop. The Wexford location is much better in terms of overall service. More then likely will never go back to this location.

1UrwJsYM8tRWmnNbzarbBA.text: Excellent food but our server was terrible. Saw her three times to order. Never checked on us and everyone else who worked here brought out food and checked on us. Great fruit and cheese plate! Ahi tuna tacos awesome!!

paUG2ccJJXvIRa2BsAyjhw.text: My girlfriend and I came here at 8 on a Saturday, the service was horrible. We waited 30 minutes for a drink from the bar, which when asked came right out. The food was good but, the portions are small and over priced. Don't recommend it.

yu-BubdAUK79wKWA9a_Www.text: Manager kicked me out of the patio while I was sitting enjoying a cocktail because he had a bigger party coming in, when there was plenty of space elsewhere in the patio to accommodate.  What a loser - he lost the business of a regular without any care.   Poor customer service - worst I have seen in my whole life all due to that manager.

sLxcEj-QlbTMfb1_XFOYaw.text: Poor food (for both of us) and service (barely asked how things were and they were not...good)...sorry to say nothing good about the visit

amxx36LkOdHdXdhIfP65Zw.text: Gave WG another chance due to a gift certificate from a horrible experience at another WG. Well I should have declined. The price and quality do not match. The prices are Morton's but the food is Eat and Park. The pumpkin ravioli was flavorless and room temp. The side salad greens were limp and lacking any pizzaz. The beer menu was decent enough but after three chances on food and three really disappointing experiences I'll take my money elsewhere.

yj1m_RblaJSEH83a6TesGA.text: Worst experience ... I have worked in restaurant business for over 20!years .. I accidentally spilled a drink and bartender was so rude !!   I went to order another drink and she asked me if I was going to spill this one !!!  We talked to manager but he had no back bone ... Unbelievable that these people have no respect for customers ... I will never be back there or recommend anyone to your restaurant !! You just lost tons of business !!

y2kowZbUsBgRGcgCGZA00A.text: Stopped in to this new Walnut Grill, formerly Stone Pepper location.  Have enjoyed some happy hours drinks and appetizers at some other WG's but we stopped in for a meal.  My Blackened Salmon BLT was OK, the bacon was tasty but the fish was not real good or fresh.  The sweet potato fries were large slices of potato and OK.  We sat in the bar area and it was busy and looks like it will be a typical WG.  There are about 30 beers on tap.

46ITOpxHjv0sH1HabhOrhA.text: I really enjoyed my meal here!!! I got the lobster Mac n cheese it was very good and to my surprise it came with two crispy pieces of bread to dip in! I was super excited about that. My bf got a RueBen, fries, and a side of French onion soup. He said it tasted good but nothing out of this world or anything. I have had their parmesan crusted chicken and sirloin in the past and I have never had a bad experience here! I will say it's a little over priced, but it's good.

5L4D_DEAPt547QGOLY56IA.text: My husband and I had lunch on a weekday and service was great, waitress friendly and helpful. Food was good and we are going back tonight with friends.

NMyx_thSgQA0YEuLWC-IYw.text: When we arrived at Walnut  Grill our waitress informed us it was still Happy Hour. So we hurried up and ordered. Our waitress was wonderful. She Helped with Gluten Free items and a menu. The food was great I ordered Blacken Salmon BLT it was awesome.  I liked the atmosphere and felt it was a great place to socialize.

EKsgUqSp43SbwEEorE5XtQ.text: Love this place...great menu selections with just enough variety. Have been there four times so far and every time we have received great service! Will keep going back!

VOWqn-vpC_tKk7M_SIV02A.text: As a Realtor in the Robinson area, I often take clients out to eat and I finally found the perfect place to impress friends, colleagues, and clients alike!! The charming staff and atmosphere was just the kick off to the best experience being educated and entertained by the bar tender as we laughed and bonded over craft beer selections and insanely well prepared food! If you are looking for a relaxing and fun time where food quality and service is taken very seriously, go see Devon at the bar or in the dining room and make sure you say hi to the best manager, Jim!! Thank you Walnut Grill for making my clients and myself so happy ;)

zxCtK-Zk72EhWLVhS0hWjw.text: Great food!! Excellent chicken salad...didn't receive great service though. My daughters food came and the waitress threw it on the table and didn't say a word. No personality what so ever. But will go back for another delicious pittsburgh salad!!

e-lXlTVBOKCXY0JnTs3Jog.text: I had dinner here last night and I don't know why all the negative reviews. Yes, they are a little pricey, but their service was great (thanks Mary and Elysse!), and the food I ordered (Pork Osso Buco w/House slaw), was great. I would definitely eat here again. I did have a 10 of 60 coupon to try this place. It is way better than Stone Peppers was, that place was awful!

iG7dAEmCjxEiayCa5b5Aag.text: Went to walnut with a friend before going to a movie. Waited almost 20 min for our waters (wine took longer), told waitress we only had an hour before the movie, food came out with 10 minutes to spare. Good food, horrible service and wait time, no one comes to check on you

KQxH5HnuHppUhBZ6KsV7wQ.text: Atrocious. Absolutely terrible. Would never come back.The only things that were mildly ok were the drinks and the fact that no one was actively rude. We had to go get our own menus, the food took about an hour to come out once we had the opportunity to even order (our waitress would disappear for half hours at a time before we even ordered and that was even before we got drink orders in which also took forever to get to us even though we saw them sitting at the bar.) The food didn't come out as it was described on the menu at all: I ordered the Ruben eggs Benedict which sounded interesting and delicious. It came out as a poor excuse for a meal, missing cheese and having an anemic amount of substance. It was mostly large pieces of bread and one single slice of corned beef on each piece that they probably bought for 12 at giant eagle next door. The "dinner size" of the orange chicken was laughable and by laughable I mean sad. It was $17 for two tiny pieces of chicken tenders covered in sugar basically. I don't feel bad writing this review. We used to go to the one in mt Lebanon and it was pretty good. But this location was a poor excuse for a restaurant. And they certainly did NOT deserve the $47 we paid for the awful service and food. Sorry but this place sucks.

BPmp3NAUK9D3SjRRUA1HLQ.text: Great lunch offerings and ambiance. Split "Pick a Pair", Seared Tuna Tacos and Caramelized Walnut Salad, along with Parmesan Crusted Chicken & Gnocchi. Perfect amount of food for two people. Will definitely come back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States

eqRhikT_oKHjYtvlXwSMEw.text: If I could give zero stars, I would. Had reservations, was seated immediately however NO one waited on us. After 15 minutes we left. 3 servers looked at us and nothing. Very disappointing

pxJaKtzDxiQvWnUlwvAQ_A.text: Service was slow for an empty place . The GF's soup salad combo was good , the Pittsburgh steak salad was a joke For $17 , you can get a better salad from your local pizza shop . I paid an extra $7 for tips and I got like 2oz of meat ! Probably wouldn't come back . Unless I was just Drinking I wonder how long it would take to get a beer

hV0eOt9iyCedOsfXwhiyZg.text: Right by my Gym! the walnut grill is a healthy alternative to the surrounding restaurants. I came here on a Sunday after working out, I am not the guy who goes to restaurants to get a salad exactly, but the salads here were A-OK, good amount of different fruits, nuts,cheese, and greens. I got a beat salad w/ shrimp, tasted like some quality ingredients were used to make it.   I just wish I had more, the salads average like 13-17 dollars with meat, for that price I would hope to have some more salad is all- if a rating was just based on service, cleanliness, and taste I would say the walnut grill would be a 4 star.   Definitely left a good impression, very clean place to eat- looks like it has a good variety of food, I will definitely come again.

_7qIi5EZ6rXZbSwu3vSCLQ.text: Had Walnut Salad and Flat Bread...amazing.  Fi wished off with Banana Bread Split.  Happy Hour 5-7.  Amazing food.  Great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Banana Bread Split...wow

zYekCL6QraIOVSCoPCpeHg.text: The service was fabulous, and I loved the Brie quesadilla with raspberry sauce! Unique flavor combo and delicious. My fiance loved his steak as well. Not sure why this place is rated low. It's a must try.

5oKrBcQD-a4TEgqCyXbfxA.text: Good service.  Had Erica's Frojito which was very good (even if my husband said it looks like a drinkable salad) if you're a mojito fan. Ahi Tuna appetizer could use a little more pizzazz for my taste buds. Carmelized walnut salad was ok.  Hubby's pasta dish was very good.  Can't remember what it was called but I think it was a new item. The beef in it was very tender.

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Carmelized Walnut Salad
Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Pasta dish
Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Erica&#39;s Frojito

G_nWltWqy71ODvNLLCSYUw.text: We just came for appetizers and drinks. Great service and great live music.  We both loved the apps drinks music and service and atmosphere

Cj0-JcOCTh08bYmLqLR5oA.text: This place is constantly hit or miss. Mostly misses. The food is usually decent but the service is almost always lacking. I once waited 50 minutes to be served when the restaurant was nearly empty.

ddIFLen4DUvnejY_2gCbOw.text: Had a wedding rehearsal dinner here on 5/4/17....We were running very late, but it didn't matter....Everyone was so gracious....Thank you Rich (and staff) for being so pleasant and accommodating!....and the food was tasty!

ULuKcXoVhktvOiy_8FLrjQ.text: Dearest future customers I'd like to let you know I've given this place 3 take out chances and 1 dine in experience and I have nothing great to say. Order with caution. It's not that I have experienced bad tasting food but poor quality service and mediocre presentation and sad all around. My dine in experience wasn't recent but it was slow service but I wanted to give another chance..The past 2 take out orders have had missing food,but this 3rd time will be my last time. My fiance ordered your $26.00 crab cake dinner and it was  a laugh. The two crab cakes were mostly crab and I will give you that but they were 1/2 the size of my fist along with the mushy side vegetables.To top it off everything was cold. We also ordered fish tacos and they were ok and still pretty warm but the guacamole that came on the side was brown meaning it was either old or someone forgot lime juice I had sweet potato fries on the side and they were really cold much colder than the tacos. My mom ordered a salad with an add on of Ahi Tuna she had no c/o anything being wrong. I could keep going but I think this says enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Crabby crab cakes

S4CONqMrvRymOgmx2xvrFA.text: Based on several visits. Sunday brunch, drinks and apps and meals. Good service and food. No complaints. Enjoyed the loaded tater tots appetizer with the melted cheese sauce & candied jalapenos. The wings were very good. Have tried something different every time and have not been disappointed. Like the chili. Tried the pick 2 with the crab cake. Tasty!

he6hjFnJo11nsReNWg9H2g.text: Service was fine, not very crowded (we went during lunch). we had a party of ten with reservations yet they sat us at a high top which was not very comfortable or spacious. There were many other options they could have put us. Drinks and food came out pretty quickly, nothing really to complain about here.   I got a shaved prime rib sandwich, mashed potatoes as a side and an order of tater tots. The tater tots were the best part by far. The mashed potatoes were pretty good and would order again. However, the sandwich was very disappointing. To start off with, I ordered it without mushrooms and peppers, and i swear they gave me extra peppers and mushrooms. Plus it was all cooked together so it was extremely difficult to simply pull them off. The beef was very bland and kinda lukewarm. The baguette it came on was pretty good. There was no au jus sauce to dip it in which was a little disappointing.   I would go back, simply because I have heard many good things and I would give it another shot, but overall, it was very "meh"

WOZ2r-Mp0wJIkgMntQ3f1w.text: I have not posted a review in a while, but felt that I would because my experience was wonderful at this Walnut Grill.  I was there on Friday night for happy hour and Jim the bartender was so spectacular.  He was fun, engaging, and very attentive.  I will return to this location because of his fabulous service.

HmMp4sglxho0kSR8cqJMbg.text: Absolutely Delicious! The atmosphere is nice and relaxing. The drinks are on point!!! Waitress was very attentive and timely...even the Mgr stopped by to ensure we were satisfied! I will definitely return on my next visit to Pittsburgh!

cJvr2Kaot9SQ8xvmIsh8dw.text: Jim always makes the work day better with his service at the bar. One of my favorite places to go for lunch in Robinson.

2F26HlD6fS6tzK0u1nf3mw.text: This has to be the worst restaurant experience I have had in many years.  We had a party of 7.  It took 1 hour for our food to arrive after we ordered and the restaurant was empty.  When the food arrived only 4 or 7 meals came.  3 of those were completely burnt (black).  I should have taken photos to post but I did not think about it until after they removed the meals.  It then took another 30 minutes for everything to be served.  The manager did comp the meal but I would rather pay for a meal that is good than to get a bad on for free.  We will never be back.

UYaAhzkaeXTqkRscKKWSsw.text: Terrible experience!! We had a dinner reservation for a group of 6 people. The waitress immediately told us that they were a little behind and that they might be slow with our food order.  We waited a very long 1 hour and 20 minutes before we received our salads and an additional 20 minutes until we received our food!  An hour and 20 minutes?!! The restaurant looked fairly busy when we arrived but tables emptied quickly so I'm not understanding the reason for the poor service.  We asked the waitress if they were short of help and she said that they had plenty. The quality of the food was ok but certainly not worth an hour and 20 minute wait.  This was our 1st and last experience with the Walnut Grill at Settlers Ridge.  We will not return.

EMpCG_mhYDMF_36OPmpF9Q.text: Ambiance and service were pretty good. Food came out relatively quickly, but our waitress did take a while to come back at the end when we needed our check. Normally not a big deal, but it was lunch hour on a work day so we were in a bit of a hurry.   Food was okay, but not worth the price. Thai pork mac and cheese was good but could have been better on the cheesiness factor. We ordered the 1/2 sandwich and salad options - buffalo chicken wrap (pretty small serving size for a half but not bad in taste); reuben (the most disappointing item we got. The beef and flavors were good but the salt content was enough to kill a small human); candied walnut salad (pretty good); strawberry balsamic salad (also pretty good but balsamic dressing was goopy and sugary).   Probably wouldn't come back again since there are many other options in the area.

BewJPpPyDFRXEoF4Obudug.text: Very mediocre. Chicken in the wrap was burnt. The salad was just spring mix, so not very filling if you don't add a protein. Service was quick and friendly. Okay to try out, but wouldn't return.

g99UyiHNUzFrRa9OcUrOOg.text: Three stars is all this place is going to get from me. This was my second attempt at liking this Walnut Grill, and honestly it will likely be my last visit.  The server greeted us and was friendly and attentive enough, but decided it would be a good idea to start with telling us how he was recovering from a hangover. Cool.  This place could be so much more. Good menu, nice drink selection, etc. But it was EMPTY when we were there and the food was simply okay. Soup was a little too salty, cheese on my sandwich wasn't melted, table was sticky. Just a lot of misses.  My husband said it best. They need to decide if they are five stars or two. They are not the only option in the area. The decor says "hip, kinda swanky, upscale bar but not too fancy". The food and service say Applebees. Just confusing.

pCU-Tb4g1PVgjliuZg7l1g.text: Not impressed with the food. We ordered the Fried Brussel Sprouts. They were very tasty. A bit gummy but overall were quite good. The side salad portions were large and fresh. The Atlantic Cod dinner was not good at all. Quite over cooked. My Crispy Chicken BLT Wrap was pretty good. Very large portion. The fries were nice and crispy. The manager came over to ask how our meals were. She agreed that our fish was over cooked. She was apologetic and bought us a round of drinks. We were there on a beautiful summer Friday night yet the place was not crowded at all, which should have tipped us off. No complaints about the service. The ambiance is very nice. We're not sure if we will return. Overall bill with drinks for three was $120 including gratuity.

SOREkOXr0FG_5FMZtAUGgQ.text: Saturday night, so there was a wait.  Service at the bar was great.  Bar tenders we're friendly and fast. Once we were seated, our drink food order was quickly taken and the salad came soon afterwards. Unfortunately, the entre didn't drive for another 40 minutes. That is the only reason they didn't get 5 stars. The food was excellent.  Well prepared and presented. We will return.

A8Ip0zB0euzx4Z1iFoQo4A.text: My daughter  and I went in this eve,for  some dinner after shopping. The hostess greeted us and showed us to our table. We were the only ppl in the restaurant other than 3 sitting at the bar. We ordered BLT wraps and the cook  sent them out, cold and not even wrapped just laying on plate, flopped open. Accompanied by cold hard sweet potato fries. Shockingly awful a9s we had had great food here on other occasions. My daughter called the waitress over,who was also appalled by the cold ,awful food. She was very apologetic and took the food back,as we left. Have some pride In What you put on a plate! Unreal. We will NOT be back,......unreal. if there was a choice for 0 stars for this  disaster,I would have chosen that!

U5a43_BAZyu4LgNtoR2qUg.text: Not so great service. Terrible decor and lighting. Bright white lights were blinding and migraine-inducing. The dining room tables and chairs are crammed in like sardines. Stick to the Bridgeville location.

--yuMxAkbD7bXdqDk0R5IQ.text: The new Walnut Grill in Robinson looks nice.  I went with a group during lunch.   I ordered the Beer Battered Cod fish sandwich and fries.    The sandwich was HUGE.    The sandwich was okay.   The food came out hot and was cooked correctly.  The batter was not as crispy as I would of liked it and lacked flavor (I love beer battered fish).      The overall experience was good.     Ambiance - Great - this could be a good place for happy hour in the future Service - Great - the server did a nice job and was polite. Food - Okay - cooked correctly but lacked some flavor I was looking for Price - :-( - They have lunch specials.  Many of their items start over $10 (average $12-14).  I believe my bill was over $15

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Fish sandwich is huge

kTVanaFR1zLMxQ5BkzVV1Q.text: My husband and I LOVE it here. We frequent the restaurant and usually sit at the bar. Everyone is so so friendly and the food is delicious. I am pretty particular with my food, and they always accommodate my requests without hesitation! The best food in Robinson!

9EN8hNDBeDhYp_cHdEHfIg.text: Our waiter was amazing. The food not so much. We ordered the pulled pork street tacos and the flavors did not mesh well. My long Island iced tea was a joke. It came out almost clear and in no way tasted like a long island iced tea. They did remake it, but yet again I felt as if I were choking it down. My daughter enjoyed her kids meal at least.

dbHvidtg7l6bMIgeiGJAHA.text: We've been coming to Walnut Grill in Robinson since it opened- but the last 3 times we've been there it has not been a pleasant experience- each time we've waited more than 40 minutes to be seated- which is fine given it's a busy dinner time. However we've also waited an hour for food. This last time we ordered apps and kids meals- which ended up coming AFTER our entrees both of which were cold- our waitress checked on us several times- but there seems to be a huge disconnect with the kitchen and the staff.

wL5XDH7VHz5Odu_a1JsEAQ.text: I went expecting a great meal based on a recommendation. I was not impressed. The onion soup had large onion slices which made it hard to eat. Next, the salad was warm as if it was sitting out. Finally, the steak was cut into and burned. The baked potato was the only thing that was acceptable to eat.

o2wQe_58xeEoAUSw5QhHgQ.text: Absolutely without a doubt our 25th anniversary dinner was outstanding from the time we walked in to the final goodbye the staff was fantastic. Do yourself a favor and go to this walnut grill you will be glad you did?

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States

6DrcRDzVYtl5kpR0FFEfmQ.text: Jim was our Bartender/Server and he was the best!! We were taken care of quickly and very politely! Jim has a great attitude and is upbeat and really makes you feel comfortable during your visit!! I will definitely return based on Jim and breakfast till 3pm.

zWaNDQMNYel5NGOkD3Ue3A.text: I have always loved the food at Walnut Grill. The atmosphere, drinks, and food are all very good. I didn't have an issue with the restaurant until the last time I went. My boyfriend and I really wanted to sit outside because of great weather, and we were excited because usually the outside tables are full, but there about 8 tables empty. However, when we asked to sit outside, the hostess said that there was nothing available. I understand if they were short-staffed, but there was no explanation after we asked why we could not be seated outside. We then proceeded to basically be ignored once we were seated inside, and we almost missed the movie we were going to after dinner. Overall, I would recommend this restaurant if you're looking for good food and drink, but I would also caution you to get there early enough if you have plans after!

6hGE6GxhAhlqYWgm25F8Mw.text: Like the others, this Walnut Grille is an ok place for a casual dinner. It is, however, remarkably unremarkable. It's a nice restaurant, but there is nothing unusual or special about the menu, wine list, or service. If you're shopping in the area it's a convenient place for dinner, but not a destination on its own. We like the app lobster mac and cheese as a entre, usually with a salad to start, and one of their fairy-priced Chardonnays to wash it down.

8YvwT-GBl3y_pMVtAND31A.text: I have been to the Walnut Grill In robinson three times. I was giving them the benefit of multiple visits. Never again! Today was the last straw. We waited to be seated and then waited for the server to take our drink order. My husband ordered coffee and I had iced tea. She brought them but forgot the cream. We never saw her again. We waited for ten minutes and left. I could understand if they were busy but there was maybe one or two tables and they weren't there when we came in. We walked out and will never go back again!

i_WERBeW_rT6Hvb9Mal3FA.text: I am a fan of walnut grill. The former mt Lebanon location was great - used to go there weekly. The Bridgeville location is good - DJ is great. The Robinson location has an awesome staff and is about 10 minutes from my house so I come here often.   This review for the Robinson location specifically. The bartenders are always awesome.  They have a great drink selection and multiple t.v.'s so it's always a go to spot to grab some drinks.  I have had a few issues in the past waiting forever to get my food.  Also, on 2 occasions, I was there when it was cold outside and it was freezing inside as well.  The menu has a little bit of everything and I'm never disappointed with the food....it's always a little above average and consistent.   My only real issue with this location is the one manager (bald gentleman) was very unfriendly to my wife and I one time and then very rude and condescending to my wife another time. The owner of walnut grill ended up being apologetic and very friendly though so I'm not going to give a bad rating over one guy.   Overall, solid neighborhood bar / restaurant...very friendly bartenders...good food...really good drinks...very nice owners.

j4M_ZDxbnO94O44TtbtY0Q.text: Not the place to go if you're in a hurry. We dined in this past week, with reservations, and it took just shy of two hours to serve our lunch food (sandwiches and flatbreads, nothing crazy). Sever was inattentive. Most restaurants around here are excellent at accommodating working (one hour) lunches.. not Walnut Grill. Food was good - but I would never come back for lunch.

Lv-MBb6FOHxBoWTrwh4MDA.text: Love this place! Sometimes the service is a little slow even if they're not busy,which can be a little frustrating , but other than that LOVE IT! great food, great drinks and specials, really nice staff!

o66G8ms87HcAzRDBfWPNog.text: Good craft beer list, another awesome set up, not too far from the city. The food was good too! Will be going again to get full meal as we only got appetizers

Dae1uLzPmDAYR7axOgae8g.text: Daughter and I went here the other night for diner. We both had the special which was filet mignon and a baked potato and french onion soup. The filet was delicious and the french onion soup was among the best I have ever had. The service was super fast and waitress was really friendly. The price for two of us with drinks and tip was like $42 a bargain for such a delicious meal. If I am ever in that area again I would definitely go there again.

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States
Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States
Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States

s5DMVCEY4laSpkPdKdrTVw.text: Alec was an awesome server. Very attentive and personable. Breakfast was great and much less chaotic than FW around the corner which had a long wait (always). Had the California Benedict and it was delish.

M28hzRUUEe1u09hb3n2NPg.text: Wow. Did a late Sunday lunch,  all our food great.  Prices very reasonable. Sundays do  breakfast offerings until 3 pm. Tasty, nicely presented good food. My burger cooked to order! Other orders, also wonderful. Great menu check it out.  Especially liked the service. Jennifer, our server was  so good, knew the menu, answered our questions regarding food & drinks. Always handy as needed but not intrusive. Nice to go to a place w/ good, good food and have a delicious lunch without a server interrupting every 2 minutes ..need water, tea...  duh,  in so many places difficult to carry on any conversation b/c  servers are trying to help but instead are a constant  interruption to a private  or business conversation. Good staff, great food.

alfyETQ610fWG8H53bcmCA.text: I've heard such good things about this place. Too bad my experience didn't reflect that at all.   Immediately when we walked in, there was a nice atmosphere, and wasn't busy for a Tuesday happy hour. We sat in a booth by the bar and waited initially for our waitress for some time. She was short with us and immediately wrote us off after we just asked for waters to start (which, the water had a lemon in it but tasted almost... fishy? Nasty.)  Our waitress only had 4 tables including my friend and I's. She took solid gaps of time where she would disappear and not come back for 10+ minutes before we could order or ask for anything. By the time we got a sample for a wine, happy hour was over so we just stuck with no drink at all. Not worth the hassle.   When the food finally came out, it was mediocre. My Cobb salad tasted like it could be from a hospital cafeteria. The ranch was definitely mixed with water, was loose with no flavor at all. Best part of it was the crunchy bacon though. That was awesome. My friend's bowl had huge chunks of garlic but otherwise she seemed pleased.   Then it got weird. We watched our waitress literally run full speed to her car and take off. After being done with our meals and waiting for someone to acknowledge us (the only person around was the bartender at this point unfortunately, and another waitress who was only addressing a new table and avoiding us at all costs), we went to the hostess who told us our waitress left to get the rest of the employees Dairy Queen. I'm sorry, but are you kidding? I know employees need to eat too, I get that, but you left service with 3 open tables (but let's be real you ignored us or treated us like a pain in your ass for the most part anyway) to get Dairy Queen?? The hostess told us we could have the bartender help us close out. Sure thing.  Funny enough, as we got ready to leave, our waitress came back and cleared our table and flashed us both a nasty look and didn't say anything at all.   Shameful service. Here's to hoping it was an off day but based on some other reviews, I doubt it. I will never, ever come back.

WqG5C9eEboQiUEr6fMBqbg.text: Went here for brunch with my husband and our 4 yr old son. Service was terrible, no check backs and had to wait about 20 min to get a servers attention for a simple refill on my coffee.  Took about an hour for our food to come out including our sons kids pizza. My veggie frittata tasted like pure butter and my husbands food was cold. Very bad experience!

NOTRYUhaJewuiSJSwyboRw.text: It's a Wednesday night and we decided to try this place for dinner.  When walking inside, we noticed that it is clean with a current decor.  The hostess was friendly and offered us a seat in the bar area or dining area.  We chose the dining area as it was a bit quieter and we wanted to be able to talk.  The place was about 80% full, but we managed to get a booth.  After perusing the menu, we noticed the appetizers and entrees were fairly pricey and since we had never tried this place, we opted for a couple of sandwiches for our first visit.  My hubby settled on the Shaved Prime Rib Sandwich with fries and I chose the Beer Battered Cod Sandwich with fries.  After we ordered it took about 20 minutes for the food to come out.  At first glance, the plates looked pretty good (picture posted of the fish sandwich).  However, upon further inspection, the food was lacking in a big way.  The fish on the sandwich was cooked well on the inside but the batter was far from crispy.  In fact, it was down right soggy.  So much so that when trying to cut through it with a fork, it seemed like rubber.  The shaved prime rib sandwich had more bread than steak. Ultimately, better than the old SteakUm's used to be, but nothing to be excited about.  Hubby said it was "meh".  The fries sort of tasted like they had been reheated and there was absolutely no salt to be found on them.  Our whole meal had an overwhelming lack of flavor.  Thank goodness for ketchup and tartar sauce.    The service was good and our server was attentive and polite.  She refilled our drinks without being asked and brought the check in quick fashion when we were ready to leave.  The big bonus were the little bowl of mints on the way out.  We won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Fish sandwich - deceptively good looking.  Soggy batter and chewy fries.

AVvSiyFsNu0fsVPwfG6zFg.text: Not sure how this place is still in business. We sat for an hour waiting for our food, all the while watching other people get theirs that came in after us. Inexcusable. We were told the kitchen was backed up... the place was not even half way full. Shut it down and open up something new, this place is irredeemable.

VGgzDnfEq3vI8Tt-pXOIAA.text: Visitors in town, we weren't sure of which restaurant to select and choose Walnut Grill from previous Yelp reviews and after scrolling their online menu which appeared very promising. We were not disappointed! The restaurant is spacious and beautiful and the service very good, however it was the food that was the most exceptional. My husband enjoyed encrusted Atlantic cod while I ordered the Korean barbecue bowl with salmon and we shared the calamari for an appetizer. Absolutely delicious every bite. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States
Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States

jp7LzkUmLHwPKbxPPicSlQ.text: This is a convenient place for a happy hour drink and snacks or a lunch date with a friend. They have good drink specials every day of the week (I personally favor Mojito Monday) and they always have a good selection of beer on tap. The service is generally pretty good, and the staff is friendly. They have some creative salads (I like the Strawberry Balsamico, add salmon), but they can be pricey if you get one that doesn't come with a protein and decide to add on. I haven't had anything bad here, but also nothing extraordinary. I would recommend if you aren't looking for a food experience, but just want a reliable place to hang out with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Turkey Sandwich / Strawberry Balsamico lunch combo
Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States

DXAqqQf1aj3TbAgQW9IyOg.text: Mediocre at best. Service is terrible. Food bland. Not impressed. If you only knew what my husband and I went through before receiving this mediocre food... save your money and go somewhere else. We won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States
Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States
Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States

WLgSOjZ9lYoC6igWvqCXew.text: Uncooked fries and over cooked creme brulee does not a good dinner make. It seems like this place has turned into a sad excuse for a restaurant. Frozen vegetables (it's hard to miss freezer burn) that aren't even cooked through properly... most people prefer fully cooked potatoes. The French onion soup was a sad puddle lacking flavor. The creme brulee that should have been a silky custard was a vanilla flavored omelette. Fresh produce and cooking lessons are strongly advised for the chefs working here.

Qokulet91SRMfXy_lXYLtw.text: My family always ends up at the Robinson location since this is closest to us.  We've always had a great experience except for last night.  Our waitress was incredibly slow and for the most part, seemed to disappear.  I've had Steve in the past and he is an excellent server.  I saw him at the next table and said hi wishing I could have had him again.   He is always so "on it" attentive and will make your dining experience what it should be. Back to our waitress, she didn't even explain what vegetables we would each be getting with our meal.  My husband and I swapped veggies.  Also, for reasons I will not even write in this review, my son was offered a second meal.  However, three out of five dinners were fine and were enjoyed.   One of the dinners were not able to be finished and my husband didn't like the cod on his plate.  So overall all, food was hit and miss.  The waitress was slow and nearly nonexistent.  In the end, the manager came over to the table and helped come up with a solution regarding two of the dinners.  She seemed concerned and listened to what happened.  My only guess is that there were not enough cooks on a busy holiday, mother's day or something was off in the kitchen entirely.  We will give them another chance and hopefully I'll be lucky to have Steve as my waiter.  I'll certainly ask to be seated in his area.

mRqjdSSbZfRqG0rbMTcbAQ.text: I honestly really like Walnut Grill. We just had a pretty terrible experience.  Five of us co workers came for lunch. My colleague and I picked the restaurant because we have never had a bad experience and the food is pretty good.  However, this day was pretty terrible. We were seated fairly quickly so that was good. We had a table in the large eating area. It was not crowded at all.   We sit down and our server comes over and takes our drinks. She comes back with our drink orders then we order food. We waited for about an hour to get our food. No one came to check on us until about 5 minutes before the food came out. It appeared there might have been a problem in the kitchen but no one came out to let us know.  Our food came finally came out and it was just alright. We were not offered an explanation as to what happen or an apology. Honestly I will not be coming back to this location any time soon.

xyPT2--tQtBfiJ2q9xnhRQ.text: Should have realized this was not the place to eat.  Only restaurant not crowded at lunch time.  Service extremely slow. Took 25 min just to order and another 25 min to get food. Too much time for a weekday lunch. Staff rude. Long wait time for food that was just ok.  Two tables around us sent food back for not being cooked and wrong order.   Staff unapologetic for wait time and lack of good service.   Don't waste your time here

p3xUE7ny6snc_XFeoXVK1A.text: We went to the breakfast with Santa and had the buffet.  I have to say it was the WORST breakfast I ever had in my life.  First, it was very difficult to actually get food. Most of the serving containers were empty.  It wasn't even that busy! We had our young son with us who like most men, loves bacon. My husband stood up by the buffet for almost 15 minutes waiting for the bacon that many staff members said was coming.  Eventually someone said they ran out, 40 minutes after it had started... My husband returned to eat the plate of cold food, comprised of whatever he was able to find, about 1/3 of what was to be offered on the buffet.  We didn't even get to eat together. Total waste of time and money.  Would have been better off at McDonald's.   It was so bad I wouldn't even return for dinner.

hqcz2XhW4oBeqmkgjkfX8A.text: Mother's day May 12, 2019,  we had reservations for 7:00 for four people, my daughter, myself, my girlfriend and her daughter celebrating Mother's day.  When we arrived we were told there was a 20 minute delay.  We were okay with that we went to the bar and ordered drinks.  The barmaid didn't know how to mix two of our drinks and had no resource to look it up. We told her how to make it.  Ewe then sat waiting for our table.  At 7:25 the hostess came looking for us using my first name but leaving out an important vowel so it took awhile to figure out she was looking for us.  She then showed us to our table which was a hightop which on my reservation I requested a regular table.  This was important as my friend had just had a hip replacement and it was very uncomfortable for her to sit at the hightop.  We were approached fairly quickly and we ordered waster and our dinners as we could see the place was busy.  Every once in awhile our server would stop and tell us our dinner were coming up.  After waiting over an hour we decided to leave. Our drinks were paid for at the bar  except for one that was ordered at the table. Our daughters said we will meet you at Cadillac Ranch and we will pay for the one drink.  We waited and waited and then went back into the restaurant to see what was the hold up.  The waiter had taken the credit card and went to find a manager, which took a long time actually she was standing behind us and never even introduced herself, I finally noticed her and asked if she was the manager and she replied yes.  We told her how upset we were and that we had reservations but they were sitting people without reservations.  She just stood there.  So we left.  She didn't offer to resolve the issue with maybe a gift card to come back or even a discount.  This is the last time I will darken there doors

9ZQGKT57GM0memU7Ce2PNA.text: We were here for breakfast and they had a nice selection of breakfast foods. They were very accommodating when the size of our party increased. I would recommend it for breakfast.

MawP8vwL6TRzMAgUQn4FJw.text: I went back for dinner and sat at a booth in the bar area and the service is pretty good. I got the prime rib sandwich and it was pretty good.. I would definitely get that again.

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Lobster Bisque?
Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States
Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Shaved Prime Rib Sandwich

NJL9SgNPao7bzForYCCldw.text: My friend and I met here one night for dinner & I must say it was delicious! We were there during happy hour and took advantage of their $3 appetizers! We had the spinach and artichoke dip, which I highly recommend! It was different from other dips I had before because the artichokes were big slices. But I enjoyed it very much! For my meal I ordered the Pittsburgh Salad with grilled chicken. This salad was topped with the tradition Pittsburgh topping - fries!!! The salad was very large and I took half of it home for lunch the next day. My friend ordered the buffalo chicken wrap, which she says is one of her favorites! It looked very appetizing! Our waitress was super friendly and was very helpful with a digital 10% off coupon that I had received. I will definitely be back - especially during happy hour!

OwR2qc-xEaXqxP3nBb_Teg.text: Came here for Sunday Brunch on Easter Sunday 4/1/2018.  These guys did a tremendous job.  We have a dairy allergy in the family and they were very accommodating.  With simply explaining our issue and our daughters requirements the waitress took it upon her self to talk to the chef and have her own scrambled eggs made separately.  We also asked about deserts and the waitress and chef worked together to promptly whip something up.  In general the staff were overly friendly even on the busiest of weekends (Easter Sunday).  I would highly recommend this place for lunch, dinner and ESPECIALLY Sunday Brunch.  If I had a negative the area where they have the buffet was tight.  It was very crowded for people to get to the food and/of when some of the food ran out it was difficult for people to get out of the way of the waitress/cooks to get the new food in there.  It is a tight quarter and I'm not sure what they can/would do to help this - they probably are doing the best the can with the space they have - but this would be my only recommendation for improving the place.

PQa9xEdhxVlqvOpPof5PKw.text: Decided to give this place another try. It took a few times to get a feel for what I liked here.   They carry Narcisi peach wine that I love.  My favorite appetizer is the battered zucchini- we got this tonight and it was delicious.   I ordered a healthier dish, the balsamic grilled chicken. It was delightful and had fresh basil on top.   I always upgrade and get the strawberry balsamic salad. Highly suggest!   They also served three different items with our bread, two butters and a hummus. The cherry butter is surprisingly very good.   My husband likes the $4 long islands on Saturday.   A nice place to hang out!

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States
Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Zucchini Planks
Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Balsamic Grilled Chicken

tbcE8TgCAC3QtRDrbRb26w.text: Came here for the first time for dinner with another couple.  Hubby and I ordered their mussels for an appetizer, Hubby ordered their WG Burger, and I ordered their caprese salad.  Total came out to a little over $40 (including tip).  What's Hot - Coupon when you check in on Yelp.  I received a 10% off coupon when I checked in on Yelp.  Definitely great and I loved that.  Additionally, this coupon didn't have any restrictions- like only valid during certain hours during certain days.  I've come across Yelp coupons like that, which weren't very convenient and I wasn't able to use them because of the restrictions.  Additionally, when I told our server about my Yelp coupon, there was no difficulty in having it honored.  Even better. - Quality.  Their mussels were flavorful and delicious!  There was plenty of juice soaking the mussels, as well, which I enjoyed and definitely drank up.  I loved the garlic flavor and bits of cut tomatoes in the juice.  My caprese salad had a decent serving of fresh mozzarella cheese and baby grape tomatoes with just enough balsamic dressing that didn't overpower my salad.  My husband really liked his WG Burger that came with candied bacon.   - Menu variety.  Their menu is a one page menu, which is pretty straightforward and simple.  Not overwhelming, which I like.   - Price.  My mussels are under $9.50, my salad was $12.50 and husband's burger was $13.50.  Not that bad. - Location.  It's conveniently located with the movie theatre around, other restaurants, shops, etc...  However, be prepared for parking issues during busy times/"rush hour".  What's Not - They have live music on Friday evenings.  Different strokes for different folks, but live music during a meal isn't my thing.  It was loud, which made it difficult for us to have a conversation.  We found out they usually have live music on Friday evenings until 8:30pm.  Just be aware and be prepared. - Service.  Service wasn't bad, but it was definitely slow.  We had to ask for bread sometime after they served our dinner, rather than it being given to us in the beginning.  I'm uncertain whether they're adequately staffed.  They have a service button/pager at our table, which we used a couple of times.  Our waiter was slow to answer.  Additionally, we had to regularly ask for our drinks to be refilled instead of getting automatic refills.  They also didn't ask us if we wanted more bread.    Observations - Make reservations.  This place isn't packed, but there are definitely "rush hour" times, when you have to wait.  There were about 10 people ahead of us.  My friend made dinner reservations for a specific booth, as well.     Final Answer - Willing to come back.  Good and dependable, but probably not a first choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Mussels
Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States

5aPINWMGGMkDzUijlVhttA.text: my 2nd time visiting and I was disappointed. I asked for my salmon to be well done and it came out pretty burnt.  Everything else was excellent, I didn't bother trying to send it back, I scrapped around the burnt side and enjoyed the rest.   I still highly recommend this restaurant. It has such a great atmosphere and the staff are great!

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Well done does NOT mean burnt
Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. well done does NOT mean burnt
Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Salmon, eggs, potatoes &amp; toast. They give you ketchup &amp; jelly on the side.

3hF0gfRShk8vEJSgEQx35A.text: Stopped here on our way to West Virginia. Went there right when they opened on a Friday morning and had the entire place to ourselves for half of our meal. The restaurant is huge and has indoor and outdoor seating. It is very clean and well maintained. The restroom was clean as well. The service was good. I had the Huevos Rancheros and man was it deliciousss!! The flavors were great. The tostada along with potatoes, eggs, chipotle aioli, queso fresco and pico de gallo made one heck of a delicious brekky. 5 star for the dish. My husband had the creme brulee French toast that came with Breakfast potatoes. The potatoes were very tasty, cooked to perfection with nice seasoning. 5 star to that as well. The French toast is another story though. Not sure why they called it creme brulee because they tasted no different than a regular French toast. They were dry, flavorless and deserve 2 stars. All in all, a good dine in experience!! Just stay away from those French toast and you will have a great meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Crème Brûlée French Toast
Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Biscuit was tasty
Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Huevos Rancheros Bowl

33PMmuG2bKSctooW29wAzQ.text: Did you know that when you download the app you are eligible to receive a free entree of up to 20$? You can also receive a free entree of up to 20$ during the week of your birthday. I personally have never seen an offer this generous, so before even going here I felt impressed.  Even when I came into the driveway, the smell emanating from this restaurant drew me in. Then I looked at the menu. Prices were reasonable for a restaurant this fancy. As a seafood lover, I also appreciated seeing a plentiful array of seafood options avalable on the menu.  I ended up ordering seafood pasta. The portion was very big for me so it covered me for 2-3 separate meals. I also liked that the noodles were holow which allowed them to hold more of the sauce and seafood flavor. The sauce on the pasta was very light - with a little touch of lemon, butter and olive oil with mixed with the natural juices of the seafood. I really prefer that kind of a sauce over a heavier sauce since it allowed me to really savor the natural flavor of the seafood. They also didn't skimp on the seafood either - I loved the balance of mussels, clams, shrimp and calamari, especially the calamari, YUM!  Will be coming back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Seafood pasta with mussels, calamari, shrimp and clams.
Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Seafood pasta with mussels, calamari, shrimp and clams.

O5zTTylz822rZCHadCw8bA.text: Atmosphere - good. The restaurant is bright inside (there is patio seating too), unlike most grill restaurants. There are large, half-circle booths on the left as you enter and table seating further into the restaurant. There is a bar across from the dining area, which was extremely loud.  Service - poor. Our server was not attentive. She forgot a drink order and we had to ask for refills on our drinks frequently.   Food - very good. The menu is extensive with many options for apps, salads flatbreads, sandwiches and entrees. I had the baked onion soup and parmigiana chicken and gnocchi. Both were very good.  Overall - very good. The food is good and prices reasonable (roughly $17 per entree). Over looking the service issue, we enjoyed the experience enough to look forward to returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States

ag-AFIgZqiUNfp3UmbcHVQ.text: First time coming here.  We had a family dinner.  There were ten of us.  The service was fantastic.  Our server was training someone and they both were very friendly.  Our drinks were never empty.  The food was average.  My daughter got the cheese burger and the bun was so greasy it was actually wet and soggy.  I got the balsamic chicken and it was great.   The salad that came with the meal left a lot to be desired .    My husband got a steak and said it was very good.  So some good things and some bad.  But besides the soggy bun nothing was terrible.  We are not a family to complain so she ate the meat and left the bun.

bPNxT9TbH34sNRzH-aJ_IA.text: First time here, passing thru and found it on Yelp. Great drink menu! Crab cakes were very good! And the staff was terrific! The staff had no idea who the 2nd best Pirate manager was! He was eating beside us   \_()_/ .

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Blackberry Martini

cqs6VmO7g0WpPoZpPftLvQ.text: First time customer, and we really liked the atmosphere.   Plenty of booths and tables, and even an outside seating area.   Weird hand-written sign on the door that they were closing at 8:30 for mandatory cleaning.   I owned a restaurant, and know other people that owned them, and never have I seen a restaurant close early, and lose sales, in order to clean.   Cleaning is done after hours.    If you are a "yelper", do a check in and you can get 10% off your bill.  The menu is extensive, and they also had 2 other sheets of paper with specials, which gets to be too much for me.   Our server was quick to take our drink order, but slow to fill them, and the restaurant was fairly empty.    In the end, I opted for the tortellini.  There were 4 of us and the food came quickly, but 2 orders had their sides switched.  My tortellini was tasty, but not as hot as I would have liked.  The portion size was good.  Others had salmon and chicken and liked them.  The French onion soup was liked very much.  Service was really lacking.  She didn't come by to fill drinks and when we did catch her to order another beer, she forgot to bring it and we had to hunt her down.   It wasn't until we were paying our bill that we noticed there was a "buzzer" on the table that we could have used for service.     Since service was really the bigger issue, I would come back to try something else.

BlDNanLI6omsgCeOJjZ3QA.text: This place is pretty good to grab a bite with friends to watch the a game. Their pick a pair is a really good deal and their beer selection is nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Grilled Lightly Crusted Atlantic Cod with crab meat

3Gjmuj8oMEavgW5QAoPFjg.text: This was one of the worst dining experiences ever. The wait to get a table in the nearly empty place took forever. The wait to place our order...took forever. The French toast tasted like nothing and the Nashville chicken sandwich barely had any sauce. The wait to get the check and card back took another 20 min. The place was not busy, a meal should not take a this long. Will never come back.

1QMmIf1BQL1u1wpnD5ZKsA.text: Update: I will not be returning here unless it's the last restaurant on the planet. My husband and I went for breakfast and while the restaurant was basically empty, we waited over 45 min after ordering before the bartender (also our waiter, wasn't his fault) told us we were the next ticket. He had stopped over twice prior to that to tell us our food would be up soon and that the kitchen had gotten slammed before we arrived.  We ended up leaving. On the way out I said to the hostess (who had seated us) "it's been like an hour and we weren't served" and her face was shocked.

P9C7nb2SWx--vdsvUjuFVg.text: I've known about Walnut Grill for a while now but it wasn't till a few months ago that I actually decided to go to the Wexford location. I wasn't blown away whatsoever so I thought for sure I would never return to any location . I had a sudden change of heart this past weekend and decided to give the Robinson location a try.   Needless to say there was clearly a reason I said I didn't want to go back. The menu looks enticing with all of its options but the food is nothing special whatsoever. After much debating I decided to order a Bloody Mary with my brunch. I'm a Bloody Mary snob so I was very hesitant going into it until I saw what it looked like and it seemed like it could be half decent. Wrong again. It tasted like watered down Campbell's tomato soup. I couldn't even force it down it was so bad. As a Bloody Mary fanatic, it was a disgrace that they would even call that a Bloody Mary.   Food wise I decided to go with the biscuits and gravy. I thought surely they would have to be good if my work cafeteria can manage to make good biscuits and gravy. Wrong again. It didn't event look appetizing. The gravy looked as if they decided to be cheap and replace some of the cream/milk with water. It just didn't even look right. The biscuits didn't taste fresh at all and the eggs were most definitely not poached. Having a runny egg doesn't make it poached. The egg white shouldn't be completely cooked and rubbery.   With my recent experience it's safe to say I'm done giving any Walnut Grill a chance. If you enjoy good quality, homemade food I would not recommend it. The food doesn't taste fresh and at times doesn't even taste like they made it in-house.

1zxeQ15DSxk8TU4M3LkyeA.text: ***Beware the delivery food!!*****I've been to brunch there several times and been so several locations in the St.Louis area and despite not having a cook that knows how to poach an egg, it was pretty good. I decided to order the Cobb salad for delivery as I had seen other people with it in the past. When it was delivered they had not grilled a piece of chicken for the salad, they had used the refrigerated chicken cubes that you get from the grocery store that are pre cooked - it was disgusting! Delivery is more expensive than eating in restaurant so it's not obscene to expect the same quality of food! I won't be eating here again!

IgnabRUmu7H55Gqg_mYAxA.text: Lunch yesterday with my boss. He chose this place. Very nice exterior, well maintained. Interior also very nice. The boss had a fish sandwich with sweet potato fries. It looked better than anything I ever ate while living in FL. He said it was excellent.  I had the chop salad, also excellent. Only negative thing, they serve Pepsi not Coke.

ertBLR4J1fhjlVl0hdT1Gg.text: His place is wonderful! I was hesitant based on the reviews but really didn't want to go to a "chain" restaurant while visiting. Tried he Walnit Grill and was not disappointed! The staff was friendly and the food full of flavor, served beautifully, great temps and well everything was great! The mushroom chicken was a favorite along with the stuffed banana peppers (spicy.) Hubby was happy with his meal as well. Not sure why the overall rating is low as this was a great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Mushroom chicken- his was absolutely fantastic!!!
Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Mushroom Chicken- this was absolutely fantastic!!!!
Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States. Side roast beet salad and bowl of chili with filet meat.

YYbYEnGN_S9-QDXtsGpP2Q.text: We ordered two appetizers with our party.  The stuffed peppers were phenomenal.  The zucchini was ok.  I ordered a Pittsburgh grilled chicken salad, which was $10, I added chicken which was another $5.  When I received the salad, I was extremely disappointed. I thought I was receiving a full breast.  It was a handful of old bite-size cold chicken in my salad.  The whole table was amazed.  I was not going to complain but my mother-in-law told the waitress after she asked how our food was. The waitress was super nice and did not charge for the salad, in the end. She was extremely sweet.   I would be willing to give this place another shot, however; I would not order another Pittsburgh salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Walnut Grill - Robinson - Robinson Township, PA, United States

OT6GsszB4lQxQLeBOVK-Ug.text: I stopped in here for lunch, and was very impressed with the food.  I had the Ahi Tuna Bowl; thanks to the recommendation of the bartender.  I would have never picked this - just didn't pop off the menu to me. But hey, it came highly recommended. If you have a chance, try it. It was delicious! The restaurant was clean and the service was above-average.  This is definitely a place that's on my radar for a repeat visit when I'm on my way home from the airport.

Go0OHQZncRxIsDEF5neeLg.text: We had a very bad experience here last Saturday evening with our 3 friends. The server was very unknowledgeable and didn't pay attention to us even though we were literally the only table in his section. My husband's baked potato was burnt to a crisp (?) and our friend's cheeseburger was completely burnt and he couldn't eat it. The calamari appetizer was terribly mushy. I would never go back to this restaurant.

YqCTG8_FsIh8Ky5DO2L65g.text: 4 star because we only stopped here for dessert and a drink. Great service at outdoor bar! Clean area. Drink specials were awesome! ($4 Long Island, $3 corona) can't beat that on a Saturday night. Desserts were amazing! Checked out menu while we were here, will definitely be back for food!

k790Ov9OZUv4hHKcyZ4yPQ.text: We had made a reservation several months ago for the patio for our family reunion kick off.  Although I had made the reservation for 6:30, when I called to confirm I was told it was for 6 pm.  Since those who were attending were getting into town early, this time worked.  Upon arrival, I was surprised that the tables were set up separately.  When I asked to have them put together so we can all be together to engage in family conversation, it was reluctantly done. Not sure what the issue was that made it so difficult to accommodate.  Unfortunately, for some unknown reason, the waitress forgot to put in 2 of the 15 orders.  Both orders were comped for their error, but that wasn't the point.  The food that was delivered was very good.

NV4sDzHVoFqDUmscuFc2JA.text: Food and service is good. Great management, I never had a bad experience. I will continue going there.

w6cV0G9tpnk5KP_idO3bmQ.text: Stopped in Saturday afternoon, not too crowded but was sat in the most crowded section,  service was slow, flat bread was burnt to a crisp, french onion soup was good. Probably will never return as I am sure it will not be there in a year.
